algorithm_technique: Quickselect to find median, then greedy calculation of operations for elements around the median.
Sorting the array to find the median, then greedy calculation of operations.
problem_summary_simple: Make the median of an array equal to k with minimum operations.
problem_summary_technical: Finds the median using Quickselect or sorting, then greedily adjusts elements greater than k down and less than k up.
key_insights: The median is the critical element. All elements less than the median must be increased to at least the median, and all greater must be decreased.
Quickselect provides an average O(n) solution to find the median, which is more efficient than sorting.
Once the median is found, the operations are calculated by summing the differences between elements and k, considering only those that need adjustment.
